sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with ill-conditioned matrices
message_1:
Given the system of linear equations:
$$
\begin{align*}
0.1x+2.3y-1.2z&=1 \\
2.2x-0.9y+0.7z&=2 \\
1.1x-1.2y+3.6z&=3
\end{align*}
$$

Determine the solution to this system of equations using Gaussian elimination method, and identify whether the matrix is ill-conditioned.
message_2:
First, let's write the augmented matrix for the given system of linear equations:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
0.1 & 2.3 & -1.2 & 1 \\
2.2 & -0.9 & 0.7 & 2 \\
1.1 & -1.2 & 3.6 & 3
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we will perform Gaussian elimination to obtain an upper triangular matrix:

Step 1: Multiply the first row by 22 and subtract it from the second row. Also, multiply the first row by 11 and subtract it from the third row.

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
0.1 & 2.3 & -1.2 & 1 \\
0 & -5.3 & 3.3 & 0 \\
0 & -14 & 17 & 2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 2: Divide the second row by -5.3 and multiply it by 14, then subtract it from the third row.

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
0.1 & 2.3 & -1.2 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & -0.6226 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 8.7169 & 2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now we have an upper triangular matrix. We can use back-substitution to find the solution:

Step 3: Divide the third row by 8.7169.

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
0.1 & 2.3 & -1.2 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & -0.6226 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & 0.2294
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 4: Add 0.6226 times the third row to the second row, and add 1.2 times the third row to the first row.

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
0.1 & 2.3 & 0 & 1.2753 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 0.143 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & 0.2294
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 5: Subtract 2.3 times the second row from the first row, and divide the first row by 0.1.

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 0 & 0 & 0.9615 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 0.143 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & 0.2294
\end{array}\right]
$$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

$$
\begin{align*}
x &= 0.9615 \\
y &= 0.143 \\
z &= 0.2294
\end{align*}
$$

Now, let's check if the matrix is ill-conditioned. We will calculate the determinant of the matrix:

$$
\det(A) = \left|\begin{array}{ccc}
0.1 & 2.3 & -1.2 \\
2.2 & -0.9 & 0.7 \\
1.1 & -1.2 & 3.6
\end{array}\right|
$$

$$
\det(A) = 0.1((-0.9)(3.6) - (0.7)(-1.2)) - 2.3((2.2)(3.6) - (0.7)(1.1)) + (-1.2)((2.2)(-1.2) - (-0.9)(1.1))
$$

$$
\det(A) = 0.1(3.24 + 0.84) - 2.3(7.92 - 0.77) + (-1.2)(2.64 + 0.99)
$$

$$
\det(A) = 0.1(4.08) - 2.3(7.15) + (-1.2)(3.63)
$$

$$
\det(A) = 0.408 - 16.445 + 4.356 = -11.681
$$

Since the determinant is not close to zero, the matrix is not ill-conditioned.
